courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Imaging and Clinical Electrophysiological Techniques

courses.description: This course is designed to facilitate students to understand the principles and application of the common electrophysiological investigations in hospital. These include electroencephalography, evoked potentials, electromyography, nerve conduction study, transcranial Doppler ultrasound, carotid duplex ultrasound, structural brain imaging (CT and MRI), and functional imaging (PET). Furthermore, indications and techniques for special diagnostic procedures, namely lumbar puncture, muscle and nerve biopsy will be taught.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To know the principles and indications of the following common neurological modalities and investigations:
1. CT
2. MRI
3. PET
4. NCS/ EMG/ EEG/ evoked potentials
5. TCD/ carotid duplex
6. lumbar puncture
7. muscle and nerve biopsy
courses.course_syllabus: This course is designed to facilitate students to understand the principles and application of the common electrophysiological investigations in hospital. These include electroencephalography, evoked potentials, electromyography, nerve conduction study, transcranial Doppler ultrasound, carotid duplex ultrasound, structural brain imaging (CT and MRI), and functional imaging (PET). Furthermore, indications and techniques for special diagnostic procedures, namely lumbar puncture, muscle and nerve biopsy will be taught.

courses.recommended_readings: Recommended readings will be announcement before corresponding lectures.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Chinese Medicine and Alternative Therapies
courses.description: This course will help students to acquire basic knowledge of traditional Chinese medicine, such as Yin-Yang, five elements, properties and flavors of herbal medicine and differentiation of syndromes according to the eight principles; the classification of stroke in traditional Chinese medicine, subsequent treatment and prescription; common acupuncture points, 12 regular meridians, Governor and Conception vessels; techniques of acupuncture and common sites. Alternative therapies including Tai Chi exercise will be covered. This course will also look into integrative medicine for neurological diseases.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To understand the theories and application of:
1. traditional Chinese medicine in stroke
2. acupuncture in neurological diseases
3. integrative medicine for neurological diseases
courses.course_syllabus: This course covers basic theories of traditional Chinese medicine, Chinese herbs and formulas, integrative medicine as well as the principles and practices of acupuncture for neurological diseases, such as stroke.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Feedback from students will be collected via Lecture Evaluation Form after each class, and Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) form after each term.
courses.required_readings: Required readings will be announced before the corresponding lectures.
courses.recommended_readings: Recommended readings will be announced before the corresponding lectures.

courses.description: This course adopts a “case-study” format to analyze the clinical decision in stroke, epilepsy, dementia and neuromuscular diseases; from diagnosis to management, key investigations and differential diagnosis, grading of disability, skills in patient screening and assessment will be covered. This course will equip students with the practical knowledge and approach in the evaluation and management of common neurological diseases.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To develop the clinical sense of how to approach the following common neurological diseases in daily clinical practice:
1. stroke
2. epilepsy
3. dementia and Parkinson’s disease
4. neuromuscular diseases
5. increased intracranial pressure
courses.course_syllabus: This course adopts a “case-study” format to analyze the clinical decision in stroke, epilepsy, dementia and neuromuscular diseases; from diagnosis to management, key investigations and differential diagnosis, grading of disability, skills in patient screening and assessment will be covered. This course will equip students with the practical knowledge and approach in the evaluation and management of common neurological diseases.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Caregiving Skills and Stress Management

meetings.instructor:
Professor LEE Kam Pui, 
Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent, 
Professor WONG Adrian

Professor LEE Kam Pui, 
Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent, 
Professor WONG Adrian

courses.description: This course aims to equip students with the relevant knowledge and practical psychological and behavioural-based skills for enhancing psychological and physical well-being of informal caregivers of dementia. It also aims to facilitate a holistic case management for community dementia services by teaching the concept and assessment of caregiving stress, psychological intervention for caregiving stress and medico-legal issues.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To Understand:
- concept and assessment of caregiving stress
- psychological intervention for caregiver stress
- medico-legal issues
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to equip students with the relevant knowledge and practical psychological and behavioural-based skills for enhancing psychological and physical well-being of informal caregivers of dementia. It also aims to facilitate a holistic case management for community dementia services by teaching the concept and assessment of caregiving stress, psychological intervention for caregiving stress and medico-legal issues.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Neurosurgery
courses.description: This course aims to teach students the neurosurgical management of head injury, trauma to the spinal cord, coma states, brainstem damage, epilepsy surgery, functional neurosurgery, and stereotactic radiosurgery.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To understand the following common neurosurgical diseases, its management and interventions:
1. head injury
2. spinal cord injury
3. stereotactic radiosurgery and critical care
4. vascular cerebral abnormalities and ICH
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to teach students the neurosurgical management of head injury, trauma to the spinal cord, coma states, brainstem damage, epilepsy surgery, functional neurosurgery, and stereotactic radiosurgery.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Specialty Stroke Nursing
courses.description: This course provides knowledge and skills for nurses in the assessment and management of stroke patients. It will cover nursing management in hyperacute stroke, stroke care planning, protocol making and stroke education, selected nursing topics on mattress assignment, fall prevention, dysphagia screening, incontinent care and NIHSS grading.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To understand the following special knowledge and skills that will equip nurses to care for various aspects of stroke patients:
1. hyperacute stroke
2. stroke care pathway
3. stroke severity assessment via NIHSS
4. stroke education
5. pressure sore
6. dysphagia
7. urinary incontinence
courses.course_syllabus: This course provides knowledge and skills for nurses in the assessment and management of stroke patients. It will cover nursing management in hyperacute stroke, stroke care planning, protocol making and stroke education, selected nursing topics on mattress assignment, fall prevention, dysphagia screening, incontinent care and NIHSS grading.

courses.description: This course will help students to acquire basic and updated knowledge of different aspects of neurorehabilitation: neuroplasticity, functional concepts in rehabilitation, management of spasticity and other complications from neurological impairment, rehabilitation of specific neurological disorders (e.g. Parkinson’s disease), rehabilitation after traumatic brain and spinal cord injury, motivating positive health behaviour changes, sexual rehabilitation, pain management, as well as palliative care.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To understand the theories, principles and application of following aspects of rehabilitation:
1. neuroplasticity
2. spasticity, Parkinson’s disease, motor neuron diseases, traumatic brain injury and spinal cord injury
3. motivating positive health behaviour changes
4. sexual impairment
5. chronic pain
6. palliative care
courses.course_syllabus: This course covers science and practice of neurorehabilitation for neurological diseases, rehabilitation for traumatic brain and spinal cord injury, sexual rehabilitation, palliative care, motivating behavioral changes in rehabilitation and management of pain.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Feedback from students will be collected via Lecture Evaluation Form after each class, and Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) form after each term.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Comprehensive Dementia Care

meetings.instructor:
Professor AU Wing Chi Lisa, 
Professor CHAN Yue Lai, 
Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent, 
Professor WONG Adrian

Professor AU Wing Chi Lisa, 
Professor CHAN Yue Lai, 
Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent, 
Professor WONG Adrian

courses.description: This course provides healthcare workers a broad perspective for dementia care, covering topics in prevention, pharmacological and non pharmacological treatment, as well as medical legal issues ; the respective lectures will be covered by different healthcare disciplines, including neurologist, psychiatrist, nurse, occupational therapist, physiotherapist and dietitian.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.course_syllabus:
Epidemiology and Risk factors for Dementia
Clinical management for MCI and Alzheimer’s Disease
Assessment of medical capacity and medicolegal aspects of dementia
Assessment of Cognitive Functions and Behavior
Non-pharmacological Rehabilitation for Dementia and its Behavioral Problems
Comprehensive Geriatric Rehabilitation Exercise for Dementia and Geriatric population
Wholistic Nursing Care for Dementia patients and caregivers
Brain Healthy Diet
courses.feedback_evaluation: Feedback from students will be collected via online Lecture Evaluation Form after each class, and online Course and Teching Evaluation (CTE) Questionnaire after each term.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Basic Anatomy and Clinical Approach in Neurology

meetings.instructor:
Professor KO Ho, 
Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent, 
Professor WONG Adrian

Professor KO Ho, 
Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent, 
Professor WONG Adrian

courses.description: This course aims to teach students the basic anatomy of the brain (including the brain stem and cerebellum), spinal cord and important nerves. The anatomy will be explained in light of its functions. Relationship between brain regions and behaviors will be discussed. Basic pathological classifications and the fundamentals of clinical approach for neurological diseases will be explained. Principles in history taking, methods of neurological examination (cranial nerves and limbs examination) and an overview of neurological investigations will be discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To learn:
1. anatomy of the brain, spinal cord and peripheral nerves that are relevant to clinical practice
2. classifications of neurological diseases
3. clinical approach of common neurological symptoms
4. skills in history taking and physical examination for neurological diseases
5. basic indications of common neurological investigations
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to teach students the basic anatomy of the brain (including the brain stem and cerebellum), spinal cord and important nerves. The anatomy will be explained in light of its functions. Relationship between brain regions and behaviors will be discussed. Basic pathological classifications and the fundamentals of clinical approach for neurological diseases will be explained. Principles in history taking, methods of neurological examination (cranial nerves and limbs examination) and an overview of neurological investigations will be discussed.

courses.description: This course will particularly focus on cerebrovascular diseases and stroke. It will provide basic and most updated knowledge in the following areas: vascular physiology, epidemiology of stroke, the pathogenesis, mechanisms, clinical features, treatments and prevention of stroke. Subarachnoid hemorrhage and its surgical interventions will also be covered.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To develop in-depth understanding in the following aspects of stroke and cerebrovascular diseases:
1. basic vascular sciences
2. epidemiology of stroke
3. pathogenesis, mechanisms, clinical features of stroke
4. treatments and prevention of stroke
5. subarachnoid hemorrhage
6. interventional therapy for ischemic stroke
courses.course_syllabus: This course will particularly focus on cerebrovascular diseases and stroke. It will provide basic and most updated knowledge in the following areas: vascular physiology, epidemiology of stroke, the pathogenesis, mechanisms, clinical features, treatments and prevention of stroke. Subarachnoid hemorrhage and its surgical interventions will also be covered.

courses.description: This course aims to teach students the clinical features, diagnosis, pathophysiology, investigations, and management of the following neurological diseases: epilepsy in adults and pediatrics, Parkinson’s Disease and other movement disorders, demyelinating diseases, autoimmune neurological diseases, genetics of neurological diseases, heredity neurological disorders and brain tumor, infections of the central nervous system, headache and migraine, Alzheimer’s disease and other dementia disorders, various neuromuscular diseases, and developmental disorders.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To understand the clinical features, diagnosis, pathophysiology, investigations and management of the following common neurological diseases (other than stroke):
1. epilepsy
2. Parkinson’s disease and other movement disorders
3. demyelinating diseases
4. autoimmune neurological diseases
5. hereditary neurological disorders
6. brain tumors
7. CNS Infections
8. neuromuscular diseases
9. dementia
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to teach students the clinical features, diagnosis, pathophysiology, investigations, and management of the following neurological diseases: epilepsy in adults and pediatrics, Parkinson’s Disease and other movement disorders, demyelinating diseases, autoimmune neurological diseases, genetics of neurological diseases, heredity neurological disorders and brain tumor, infections of the central nervous system, headache and migraine, Alzheimer’s disease and other dementia disorders, various neuromuscular diseases, and developmental disorders.

courses.description: This course will teach the principles and application of neuro-rehabilitation. This includes physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, clinical neuro-psychology, social work and dietetics in neuro-rehabilitation. Furthermore, poststroke psychiatric comorbidity including depression, cognitive impairment, and emotional disturbance, and its management will also be taught.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To gain a broad perspective in the following complications and multi-disciplinary management approaches of stroke and other neurological diseases:
1. poststroke cognitive and neuropsychiatric disorders
2. speech therapy
3. occupational therapy
4. physio- and chest physio-therapy
5. dietary management
6. self-management and support group
courses.course_syllabus: This course will teach the principles and application of neuro-rehabilitation. This includes physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, clinical neuro-psychology, social work and dietetics in neuro-rehabilitation. Furthermore, poststroke psychiatric comorbidity including depression, cognitive impairment, and emotional disturbance, and its management will also be taught.

1. epidemiology and biostatistics
2. research methods
3. experimental designs and planning

courses.description: Students will be assigned to have practicum sessions in cognitive and behavioral assessment in neurological setting, electroencephalogram, imaging, nerve conduction study, speech therapy, and transcranial Doppler ultrasound. The practicum will provide students with clinical exposure to the above areas that have been covered in lectures of other courses. This will enhance and consolidate students’ knowledge on these areas.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To gain exposure and / or hands on experience in the following practicum sessions:
1. Cognitive and behavioral assessment in neurological setting
2. Electroencephalogram
3. Imaging
4. nerve conduction study
5. speech therapy
6. transcranial Doppler ultrasound
courses.course_syllabus: Students will be assigned to have practicum sessions in cognitive and behavioral assessment in neurological setting, electroencephalogram, imaging, nerve conduction study, speech therapy, and transcranial Doppler ultrasound. The practicum will provide students with clinical exposure to the above areas that have been covered in lectures of other courses. This will enhance and consolidate students’ knowledge on these areas.

courses.subject: MCNS
courses.title: Project

meetings.instructor: Professor MOK Chung Tong Vincent

courses.description: Students have to write an individual report on topics relevant to stroke and clinical neurosciences. This course aims to deepen students’ knowledge in a particular neurological area that is of interest to him/her and is relevant to his/ her work. This course will also develop students’ skills in creative and analytical thinking, research methods, and research writing.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Stroke and Clinical Neurosciences
courses.learning_outcomes:
To develop:
1. a deeper and broader understanding in a specific neurological topic
2. the skills of doing a literature review, conducting a clinical study, statistical analysis, and data interpretation
3. the skills of research writing
courses.course_syllabus: Students have to write an individual report on topics relevant to stroke and clinical neurosciences. This course aims to deepen students’ knowledge in a particular neurological area that is of interest to him/her and is relevant to his/ her work. This course will also develop students’ skills in creative and analytical thinking, research methods, and research writing.
